channel.title: R on Consulting Statistician
channel.description: Recent content in R on Consulting Statistician

item.title: Build a New Package with Existing R packages
item.description: Most Essential Packages Essential Packages Still I have not Used badgecreatr and badger desc git2r and gh covr hexSticker pkgdown testthat devtools pkgbuild pkgload rcmdcheck usethis roxygen2 knitr markdown rmarkdown rmdformats spelling trackmd packrat pkgconfig pkginspector rvcheck rversions formatR whoami Package developement is a sense of accomplishment for any statistical programmer who needs self satisfaction. I developed the R package fitODBOD for the purpose of fitting Over dispersed Binomial Outcome Data using Binomial Mixture Distributions and Alternate Binomial Distributions.

item.title: How To Find Your R package ?
item.description: 1. Google 2. CRAN 3. Bio - Conductor 4. GitHub pages 5. Rdocumentation 6. Crantastic 7. rpackages 8. R - Opensci 9. Rseek 10. R Site Search 11. R-forge 12. AwesomeR 13. CRAN Task View 14. Rstudio - Rpackages 15. stack overflow - r 16. CRANalerts How to find your R package is simply a blog post helping people to provide a list of websites where they can find R packages.
